radiographic_examinations.findings: Lesions with restricted diffusion in the periventricular and subcortical white matter and the corpus callosum.
New hyperintense, nonenhancing lesions in the corpus callosum and left cerebellum.
Multiple hyperintense lesions in the periventricular, infratentorial, and subcortical white matter and the corpus callosum.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Decrease in the size and number of the white-matter lesions; MRI of the spine was normal.

radiographic_examinations.findings: CT scan of the brain was normal.

New bilateral, hyperintense lesions in the right frontal subcortical and deep white matter, enhancing lesions in the right cingulate and superior frontal gyri, left caudate body, and cerebellum; persistent lesions in the corpus callosum.
Multiple, small T2-weighted and FLAIR hyperintense signal abnormalities in the white matter within the corpus callosum and in the periventricular white matter.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeated MRI revealed new signal abnormalities with enhancement after administration of contrast material.

radiographic_examinations.findings: New puncate focus of restricted diffusion in the left splenium of the corpus callosum; unchanged foci of hyperintensity on T2-weighted FLAIR images in both hemispheres.
